DOC.brief_summary: To assess effect oral nutritional supplementation dietary counseling versus dietary counsel alone growth preschool child period 90 day .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Oral Nutrition Supplement ( ONS ) Children .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 2472 month ( inclusive ) , gender . 2 . Diagnosed current acute upper respiratory tract infection . 3 . Weightforage 3rd 15th percentile accord WHO Growth Charts . 4 . Identified picky eater . 5 . Able consume food beverage orally . 6 . Willing abstain additional nonstudy provide protein supplement nutritional supplement throughout study period . 1 . Current illness require hospitalization . 2 . Gastrointestinal infection and/or acute diarrhea time inclusion study . 3 . Currently take medication could affect absorption/metabolism study product weight child . 4 . Diagnosed recurrent respiratory infection due cystic fibrosis , immunodeficiency syndrome , congenital abnormality respiratory tract , congenital lung ciliary abnormality , unsuspected foreign body asthma . 5 . Active tuberculosis , acute hepatitis B C , HIV , malignancy . 6 . History diabetes mellitus . 7 . Received antibiotic therapy within last two week start study . 8 . Dysphagia , aspiration risk , difficulty swallow due acquire / congenital abnormality would hamper oral intake study product . 9 . Clinically significant nutritional deficiency require specific treatment nutritional supplement ( study product ) .
